Target.Name: 11-12.L.4a
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 11–12 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence, paragraph, or text; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Target.Name: 11-12.L.4b
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 11–12 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Identify and correctly use patterns of word changes that indicate different meanings or parts of speech (e.g., conceive, conception, conceivable).

Target.Name: 11-12.L.4c
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 11–12 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning, its part of speech, its etymology, or its standard usage.

Target.Name: 11-12.L.4d
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 11–12 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. D) Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

Target.Name: 11-12.L.5b
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Analyze nuances in the meaning of words with similar denotations.

Target.Name: 11-12.L.6
Target.Description: Acquire and use accurately general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Target.Name: 11-12.RH.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including analyzing how an author uses and refines the meaning of a key term over the course of a text (e.g., how Madison defines faction in Federalist No. 10).

Target.Name: 11-12.RI.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze how an author uses and refines the meaning of a key term or terms over the course of a text (e.g., how Madison defines faction in Federalist No. 10).

Target.Name: 11-12.RST.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and other domain-specific words and phrases as they are used in a specific scientific or technical context relevant to grades 11–12 texts and topics.

Target.Name: 3.L.4a
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Target.Name: 3.L.4b
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known affix is added to a known word (e.g., agreeable/disagreeable, comfortable/uncomfortable, care/careless, heat/preheat).

Target.Name: 3.L.4c
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g., company, companion).

Target.Name: 3.L.4d
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. D) Use glossaries or beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

Target.Name: 3.RI.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 3 topic or subject area.

Target.Name: 4.L.4a
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., definitions, examples, or restatements in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Target.Name: 4.L.4b
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., telegraph, photograph, autograph).

Target.Name: 4.L.4c
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

Target.Name: 4.L.5c
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Demonstrate understanding of words by relating them to their opposites (antonyms) and to words with similar but not identical meanings (synonyms).

Target.Name: 4.L.6
Target.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal precise actions, emotions, or states of being (e.g., quizzed, whined, stammered) and that are basic to a particular topic (e.g., wildlife, conservation, and endangered when discussing animal preservation).

Target.Name: 4.RI.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words or phrases in a text relevant to a grade 4 topic or subject area.

Target.Name: 5.L.4a
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Target.Name: 5.L.4b
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., photograph, photosynthesis).

Target.Name: 5.L.4c
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

Target.Name: 5.L.5c
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonyms, antonyms, homographs) to better understand each of the words.

Target.Name: 5.L.6
Target.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal contrast, addition, and other logical relationships (e.g., however, although, nevertheless, similarly, moreover, in addition).

Target.Name: 5.RI.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 5 topic or subject area.

Target.Name: 6.L.4a
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Target.Name: 6.L.4b
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., audience, auditory, audible).

Target.Name: 6.L.4c
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

Target.Name: 6.L.4d
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. D) Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

Target.Name: 6.L.5b
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole, item/category) to better understand each of the words.

Target.Name: 6.L.5c
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).

Target.Name: 6.RI.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings.

Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., refined, respectful, polite, diplomatic, condescending).

Target.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

Target.Name: 8.L.6
Target.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Target.Name: 8.RI.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

Target.Name: 11-12.RH.6
Target.Description: Evaluate authors’ differing points of view on the same historical event or issue by assessing the authors’ claims, reasoning, and evidence.

Target.Name: 11-12.RH.8
Target.Description: Evaluate an author’s premises, claims, and evidence by corroborating or challenging them with other information.

Target.Name: 11-12.RI.6
Target.Description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text in which the rhetoric is particularly effective, analyzing how style and content contribute to the power, persuasiveness, or beauty of the text.

Target.Name: 11-12.RI.8
Target.Description: Delineate and evaluate the reasoning in seminal U.S. texts, including the application of constitutional principles and use of legal reasoning (e.g., in U.S. Supreme Court majority opinions and dissents) and the premises, purposes, and arguments in works of public advocacy (e.g., The Federalist, presidential addresses).

Target.Name: 11-12.RST.6
Target.Description: Analyze the author’s purpose in providing an explanation, describing a procedure, or discussing an experiment in a text, identifying important issues that remain unresolved.

Target.Name: 11-12.RST.8
Target.Description: Evaluate the hypotheses, data, analysis, and conclusions in a science or technical text, verifying the data when possible and corroborating or challenging conclusions with other sources of information.

Target.Name: 3.RI.6
Target.Description: Distinguish their own point of view from that of the author of a text.

Target.Name: 3.RI.8
Target.Description: Describe the logical connection between particular sentences and paragraphs in a text (e.g., comparison, cause/effect, first/second/third in a sequence).

Target.Name: 3.RI.9
Target.Description: Compare and contrast the most important points and key details presented in two texts on the same topic.

Target.Name: 4.RI.3
Target.Description: Explain events, procedures, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text, including what happened and why, based on specific information in the text.

Target.Name: 4.RI.6
Target.Description: Compare and contrast a firsthand and secondhand account of the same event or topic; describe the differences in focus and the information provided.

Target.Name: 4.RI.8
Target.Description: Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text.

Target.Name: 4.RI.9
Target.Description: Integrate information from two texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

Target.Name: 5.RI.3
Target.Description: Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text based on specific information in the text.

Target.Name: 5.RI.6
Target.Description: Analyze multiple accounts of the same event or topic, noting important similarities and differences in the point of view they represent.

Target.Name: 5.RI.8
Target.Description: Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text, identifying which reasons and evidence support which point(s).

Target.Name: 5.RI.9
Target.Description: Integrate information from several texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

Target.Name: 6.RI.3
Target.Description: Analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and elaborated in a text (e.g., through examples or anecdotes).

Target.Name: 6.RI.6
Target.Description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and explain how it is conveyed in the text.

Target.Name: 6.RI.8
Target.Description: Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

Target.Name: 6-8.RH.6
Target.Description: Identify aspects of a text that reveal an author’s point of view or purpose (e.g., loaded language, inclusion or avoidance of particular facts).

Target.Name: 6-8.RH.8
Target.Description: Distinguish among fact, opinion, and reasoned judgment in a text.

Target.Name: 6-8.RST.6
Target.Description: Analyze the author’s purpose in providing an explanation, describing a procedure, or discussing an experiment in a text.

Target.Name: 6-8.RST.8
Target.Description: Distinguish among facts, reasoned judgment based on research findings, and speculation in a text.

Target.Name: 6-8.RH.8
Target.Description: Distinguish among fact, opinion, and reasoned judgment in a text.

Target.Name: 6-8.RST.8
Target.Description: Distinguish among facts, reasoned judgment based on research findings, and speculation in a text.

Target.Name: 7.RI.2
Target.Description: Determine two or more central ideas in a text and analyze their development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

Target.Name: 7.RI.3
Target.Description: Analyze the interactions between individuals, events, and ideas in a text (e.g., how ideas influence individuals or events, or how individuals influence ideas or events).

Target.Name: 7.RI.8
Target.Description: Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims.

Target.Name: 6-8.RH.6
Target.Description: Identify aspects of a text that reveal an author’s point of view or purpose (e.g., loaded language, inclusion or avoidance of particular facts).

Target.Name: 6-8.RH.8
Target.Description: Distinguish among fact, opinion, and reasoned judgment in a text.

Target.Name: 6-8.RST.6
Target.Description: Analyze the author’s purpose in providing an explanation, describing a procedure, or discussing an experiment in a text.

Target.Name: 6-8.RST.8
Target.Description: Distinguish among facts, reasoned judgment based on research findings, and speculation in a text.

Target.Name: 8.RI.6
Target.Description: Analyze how differences in the points of view of the characters and the audience or reader (e.g., created through the use of dramatic irony) create such effects as suspense or humor.

Target.Name: 8.RI.8
Target.Description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize when irrelevant evidence is introduced.

Target.Name: 11-12.RI.3
Target.Description: Analyze a complex set of ideas or sequence of events and explain how specific individuals, ideas, or events interact and develop over the course of the text.

Target.Name: 11-12.RI.9
Target.Description: Analyze seventeenth-, eighteenth-, and nineteenth-century foundational U.S. documents of historical and literary significance (including The Declaration of Independence, the Preamble to the Constitution, the Bill of Rights, and Lincoln’s Second Inaugural Address) for their themes, purposes, and rhetorical features.

Target.Name: 3.RI.9
Target.Description: Compare and contrast the most important points and key details presented in two texts on the same topic.

Target.Name: 4.RI.7
Target.Description: Interpret information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively (e.g., in charts, graphs, diagrams, time lines, animations, or interactive elements on Web pages) and explain how the information contributes to an understanding of the text in which it appears.

Target.Name: 4.RI.9
Target.Description: Integrate information from two texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

Target.Name: 5.RI.3
Target.Description: Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text based on specific information in the text.

Target.Name: 5.RI.6
Target.Description: Analyze multiple accounts of the same event or topic, noting important similarities and differences in the point of view they represent.

Target.Name: 6.RI.3
Target.Description: Analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and elaborated in a text (e.g., through examples or anecdotes).

Target.Name: 6.RI.9
Target.Description: Compare and contrast one author’s presentation of events with that of another (e.g., a memoir written by and a biography on the same person).

Target.Name: 6-8.RH.3
Target.Description: Identify key steps in a text’s description of a process related to history/social studies (e.g., how a bill becomes law, how interest rates are raised or lowered).

Target.Name: 6-8.RH.3
Target.Description: Identify key steps in a text’s description of a process related to history/social studies (e.g., how a bill becomes law, how interest rates are raised or lowered).

Target.Name: 7.RI.6
Target.Description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author distinguishes his or her position from that of others.

Target.Name: 7.RI.9
Target.Description: Analyze how two or more authors writing about the same topic shape their presentations of key information by emphasizing different evidence or advancing different interpretations of facts.

Target.Name: 6-8.RH.3
Target.Description: Identify key steps in a text’s description of a process related to history/social studies (e.g., how a bill becomes law, how interest rates are raised or lowered).

Target.Name: 8.RI.3
Target.Description: Analyze how particular lines of dialogue or incidents in a story or drama propel the action, reveal aspects of a character, or provoke a decision.

Target.Name: 11-12.RH.5
Target.Description: Analyze in detail how a complex primary source is structured, including how key sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text contribute to the whole.

Target.Name: 11-12.RH.7
Target.Description: Integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats and media (e.g., visually, quantitatively, as well as in words) in order to address a question or solve a problem.

Target.Name: 11-12.RI.5
Target.Description: Analyze and evaluate the effectiveness of the structure an author uses in his or her exposition or argument, including whether the structure makes points clear, convincing, and engaging.

Target.Name: 11-12.RI.7
Target.Description: Integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually, uantitatively) as well as in words in order to address a question or solve a problem.

Target.Name: 11-12.RST.5
Target.Description: Analyze how the text structures information or ideas into categories or hierarchies, demonstrating understanding of the information or ideas.

Target.Name: 11-12.RST.7
Target.Description: Integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in diverse formats and media (e.g., quantitative data, video, multimedia) in order to address a question or solve a problem.

Target.Name: 3.RI.5
Target.Description: Use text features and search tools (e.g., key words, sidebars, hyperlinks) to locate information relevant to a given topic efficiently.

Target.Name: 3.RI.7
Target.Description: Use information gained from illustrations (e.g., maps, photographs) and the words in a text to demonstrate understanding of the text (e.g., where, when, why, and how key events occur).

Target.Name: 4.RI.5
Target.Description: Describe the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in a text or part of a text.

Target.Name: 4.RI.7
Target.Description: Interpret information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively (e.g., in charts, graphs, diagrams, time lines, animations, or interactive elements on Web pages) and explain how the information contributes to an understanding of the text in which it appears.

Target.Name: 5.RI.5
Target.Description: Compare and contrast the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in two or more texts.

Target.Name: 6.RI.5
Target.Description: Analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph, chapter, or section fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the ideas.

Target.Name: 6.RI.7
Target.Description: Integrate information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively) as well as in words to develop a coherent understanding of a topic or issue.

Target.Name: 6-8.RH.5
Target.Description: Describe how a text presents information (e.g., sequentially, comparatively, causally).

Target.Name: 6-8.RST.5
Target.Description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to an understanding of the topic.

Target.Description: Describe how a text presents information (e.g., sequentially, comparatively, causally).

Target.Name: 6-8.RST.5
Target.Description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to an understanding of the topic.

Target.Name: 7.RI.5

Target.Name: 7.RI.7
Target.Description: Compare and contrast a text to an audio, video, or multimedia version of the text, analyzing each medium’s portrayal of the subject (e.g., how the delivery of a speech affects the impact of the words).

Target.Name: 6-8.RH.5
Target.Description: Describe how a text presents information (e.g., sequentially, comparatively, causally).

Target.Name: 6-8.RST.5
Target.Description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to an understanding of the topic.

Target.Name: 8.RI.5
Target.Description: Compare and contrast the structure of two or more texts and analyze how the differing structure of each text contributes to its meaning and style.

B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., telegraph, photograph, autograph).

Target.Name: 4.L.4c
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

Target.Name: 4.L.5a
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Explain the meaning of simple similes and metaphors (e.g., as pretty as a picture) in context.

Target.Name: 4.L.5b
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

Target.Name: 5.L.4a
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Target.Name: 5.L.4b
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., photograph, photosynthesis).

Target.Name: 5.L.4c
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

Target.Name: 5.L.5a
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figurative language, including similes and metaphors, in context.

Target.Name: 5.L.5b
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

Target.Name: 6.L.5a
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g., personification) in context.

Target.Name: 6.L.5c
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).

Target.Name: 6.RI.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings.

Target.Name: 7.L.5a
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g., literary, biblical, and mythological allusions) in context.

Target.Name: 7.L.5b
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonym/antonym, analogy) to better understand each of the words.

Target.Name: 7.RI.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

Target.Name: 8.L.5a
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g. verbal irony, puns) in context.

Target.Name: 8.L.5c
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., bullheaded, willful, firm, persistent, resolute).

Target.Name: 8.RI.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

Target.Name: 11-12.RH.1
Target.Description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of primary and secondary sources, connecting insights gained from specific details to an understanding of the text as a whole.

Target.Name: 11-12.RH.3
Target.Description: Evaluate various explanations for actions or events and determine which explanation best accords with textual evidence, acknowledging where the text leaves matters uncertain.

Target.Name: 11-12.RI.1
Target.Description: Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text, including determining where the text leaves matters uncertain.

Target.Name: 11-12.RI.3
Target.Description: Analyze a complex set of ideas or sequence of events and explain how specific individuals, ideas, or events interact and develop over the course of the text.

Target.Name: 11-12.RST.1
Target.Description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts, attending to important distinctions the author makes and to any gaps or inconsistencies in the account.

Target.Name: 3.RI.1
Target.Description: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

Target.Name: 3.RI.3
Target.Description: Describe the relationship between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text, usinglanguage that pertains to time, sequence, and cause/effect.

Target.Name: 4.RI.1
Target.Description: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

Target.Name: 4.RI.3
Target.Description: Explain events, procedures, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text, including what happened and why, based on specific information in the text.

Target.Name: 5.RI.1
Target.Description: Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

Target.Name: 5.RI.3
Target.Description: Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text based on specific information in the text.

Target.Name: 5.RI.7
Target.Description: Draw on information from multiple print or digital sources, demonstrating the ability to locate an answer to a question quickly or to solve a problem efficiently.

Target.Name: 6.RI.1
Target.Description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

Target.Name: 6.RI.3
Target.Description: Analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and elaborated in a text (e.g., through examples or anecdotes).

Target.Name: 6-8.RH.1
Target.Description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of primary and secondary sources.

Target.Name: 6-8.RH.3
Target.Description: Identify key steps in a text’s description of a process related to history/social studies (e.g., how a bill becomes law, how interest rates are raised or lowered).

Target.Name: 6-8.RST.1
Target.Description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts.

Target.Name: 6-8.RH.1
Target.Description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of primary and secondary sources.

Target.Name: 6-8.RST.1
Target.Description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts.

Target.Name: 7.RI.1
Target.Description: Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

Target.Name: 6-8.RH.1
Target.Description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of primary and secondary sources.

Target.Name: 6-8.RH.3
Target.Description: Identify key steps in a text’s description of a process related to history/social studies (e.g., how a bill becomes law, how interest rates are raised or lowered).

Target.Name: 6-8.RST.1
Target.Description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts.

Target.Name: 8.RI.1
Target.Description: Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

Target.Name: 8.RI.3
Target.Description: Analyze how particular lines of dialogue or incidents in a story or drama propel the action, reveal aspects of a character, or provoke a decision.

Target.Name: 11-12.RH.2
Target.Description: Determine the central ideas or information of a primary or secondary source; provide an accurate summary that makes clear the relationships among the key details and ideas.

Target.Name: 11-12.RI.2
Target.Description: Determine two or more central ideas of a text and analyze their development over the course of the text, including how they interact and build on one another to provide a complex analysis; provide an objective summary of the text.

Target.Name: 11-12.RST.2
Target.Description: Determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; summarize complex concepts, processes, or information presented in a text by paraphrasing them in simpler but still accurate terms.

Target.Name: 3.RI.2
Target.Description: Determine the main idea of a text; recount the key details and explain how they support the main idea.

Target.Name: 4.RI.2
Target.Description: Determine the main idea of a text and explain how it is supported by key details; summarize the text.

Target.Name: 5.RI.2
Target.Description: Determine two or more main ideas of a text and explain how they are supported by key details; summarize the text.

Target.Name: 6.RI.2
Target.Description: Determine a central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

Target.Name: 6-8.RH.2
Target.Description: Determine the central ideas or information of a primary or secondary source; provide an accurate summary of the source distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

Target.Name: 6-8.RST.2
Target.Description: Determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; provide an accurate summary of the text distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

Target.Name: 6-8.RH.2
Target.Description: Determine the central ideas or information of a primary or secondary source; provide an accurate summary of the source distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

Target.Name: 6-8.RST.2
Target.Description: Determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; provide an accurate summary of the text distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

Target.Name: 7.RI.2
Target.Description: Determine two or more central ideas in a text and analyze their development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

Target.Name: 6-8.RH.2
Target.Description: Determine the central ideas or information of a primary or secondary source; provide an accurate summary of the source distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

Target.Name: 6-8.RST.2
Target.Description: Determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; provide an accurate summary of the text distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

Target.Name: 8.RI.2
Target.Description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to the characters, setting, and plot; provide an objective summary of the text.

Target.Name: 11-12.RL.1
Target.Description: Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text, including determining where the text leaves matters uncertain.

Target.Name: 11-12.RL.3
Target.Description: Analyze the impact of the author’s choices regarding how to develop and relate elements of a story or drama (e.g., where a story is set, how the action is ordered, how the characters are introduced and developed).

Target.Name: 3.RL.1
Target.Description: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

Target.Name: 3.RL.3
Target.Description: Describe characters in a story (e.g., their traits, motivations, or feelings) and explain how their actions contribute to the sequence of events.

Target.Name: 4.RL.1
Target.Description: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

Target.Name: 4.RL.3
Target.Description: Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., a character’s thoughts, words, or actions).

Target.Name: 5.RL.1
Target.Description: Quote accurately from a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

Target.Name: 5.RL.3
Target.Description: Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., how characters interact).

Target.Name: 6.RL.1
Target.Description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

Target.Name: 6.RL.3
Target.Description: Describe how a particular story’s or drama’s plot unfolds in a series of episodes as well as how the characters respond or change as the plot moves toward a resolution.

Target.Name: 7.RL.1
Target.Description: Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

Target.Name: 7.RL.3
Target.Description: Analyze how particular elements of a story or drama interact (e.g., how setting shapes the characters or plot).

Target.Name: 8.RL.1
Target.Description: Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

Target.Name: 8.RL.3
Target.Description: Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

Target.Name: 9.RL.1
Target.Description: Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

Target.Name: 9.RL.3
Target.Description: Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

Target.Name: 11-12.RL.2
Target.Description: Determine two or more themes or central ideas of a text and analyze their development over the course of the text, including how they interact and build on one another to produce a complex account; provide an objective summary of the text.

Target.Name: 3.RL.2
Target.Description: Recount stories, including fables, folktales, and myths from diverse cultures; determine the central message, lesson, or moral and explain how it is conveyed through key details in the text.

Target.Name: 4.RL.2
Target.Description: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text; summarize the text.

Target.Name: 5.RL.2
Target.Description: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text, including how characters in a story or drama respond to challenges or how the speaker in a poem reflects upon a topic; summarize the text.

Target.Name: 6.RL.2
Target.Description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

Target.Name: 7.RL.2
Target.Description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

Target.Name: 8.RL.2
Target.Description: Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to supporting ideas; provide an objective summary of the text.

Target.Name: 9.RL.2
Target.Description: Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to supporting ideas; provide an objective summary of the text.

Target.Name: 11-12.L.4a
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 11–12 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence, paragraph, or text; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Target.Name: 11-12.L.4b
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 11–12 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Identify and correctly use patterns of word changes that indicate different meanings or parts of speech (e.g., conceive, conception, conceivable).

Target.Name: 11-12.L.4c
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 11–12 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning, its part of speech, its etymology, or its standard usage.

Target.Name: 11-12.L.4d
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grades 11–12 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. D) Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

Target.Name: 11-12.L.5b
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Analyze nuances in the meaning of words with similar denotations.

Target.Name: 11-12.L.6
Target.Description: Acquire and use accurately general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Target.Name: 11-12.RL.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in the text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including words with multiple meanings or language that is particularly fresh, engaging, or beautiful. (Include Shakespeare as well as other authors.)

Target.Name: 3.L.4a
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Target.Name: 3.L.4b
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known affix is added to a known word (e.g., agreeable/disagreeable, comfortable/uncomfortable, care/careless, heat/preheat).

Target.Name: 3.L.4c
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g., company, companion).

Target.Name: 3.L.4d
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. D) Use glossaries or beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

Target.Name: 3.L.5c
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish shades of meaning among related words that describe states of mind or degrees of certainty (e.g., knew, believed, suspected, heard, wondered).

Target.Name: 3.RL.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, distinguishing literal from nonliteral language.

Target.Name: 4.L.4a
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., definitions, examples, or restatements in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Target.Name: 4.L.4b
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., telegraph, photograph, autograph).

Target.Name: 4.L.4c
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

Target.Name: 4.L.5c
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Demonstrate understanding of words by relating them to their opposites (antonyms) and to words with similar but not identical meanings (synonyms).

Target.Name: 4.RL.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including those that allude to significant characters found in mythology (e.g., Herculean).

Target.Name: 5.L.4a
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. A) Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Target.Name: 5.L.4b
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., photograph, photosynthesis).

Target.Name: 5.L.4c
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 5 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

Target.Name: 5.L.5c
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonyms, antonyms, homographs) to better understand each of the words.

Target.Name: 5.RL.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative language such as metaphors and similes.

Target.Name: 6.L.4a
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. Target.Name: 6.L.4b
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. B) Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., audience, auditory, audible).

Target.Name: 6.L.4c
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. C) Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).
