Target.Name: 9.L.4d
Target.Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words or phrases based on grade 8 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies. D) Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

Target.Name: 9.L.5b
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Use the relationship between particular words to better understand each of the words.

Target.Name: 9.L.5c
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., bullheaded, willful, firm, persistent, resolute).

Target.Name: 9.L.6
Target.Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

Target.Name: 9.RL.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

Target.Name: 11-12.RL.2
Target.Description: Determine two or more themes or central ideas of a text and analyze their development over the course of the text, including how they interact and build on one another to produce a complex account; provide an objective summary of the text.

Target.Name: 11-12.RL.3
Target.Description: Analyze the impact of the author’s choices regarding how to develop and relate elements of a story or drama (e.g., where a story is set, how the action is ordered, how the characters are introduced and developed).

Target.Name: 11-12.RL.6
Target.Description: Analyze a case in which grasping point of view requires distinguishing what is directly stated in a text from what is really meant (e.g., satire, sarcasm, irony, or understatement).

Target.Name: 3.RL.2
Target.Description: Recount stories, including fables, folktales, and myths from diverse cultures; determine the central message, lesson, or moral and explain how it is conveyed through key details in the text.

Target.Name: 3.RL.3
Target.Description: Describe characters in a story (e.g., their traits, motivations, or feelings) and explain how their actions contribute to the sequence of events.

Target.Name: 3.RL.6
Target.Description: Distinguish their own point of view from that of the narrator or those of the characters.

Target.Name: 4.RL.2
Target.Description: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text; summarize the text.

Target.Name: 4.RL.3
Target.Description: Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., a character’s thoughts, words, or actions).

Target.Name: 4.RL.6
Target.Description: Compare and contrast the point of view from which different stories are narrated, including the difference between first- and third-person narrations.

Target.Name: 5.RL.2
Target.Description: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text, including how characters in a story or drama respond to challenges or how the speaker in a poem reflects upon a topic; summarize the text.

Target.Name: 5.RL.3
Target.Description: Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, or events in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., how characters interact).

Target.Name: 5.RL.6
Target.Description: Describe how a narrator’s or speaker’s point of view influences how events are described.

Target.Name: 6.RL.2
Target.Description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

Target.Name: 6.RL.3
Target.Description: Describe how a particular story’s or drama’s plot unfolds in a series of episodes as well as how the characters respond or change as the plot moves toward a resolution.

Target.Name: 6.RL.6
Target.Description: Explain how an author develops the point of view of the narrator or speaker in a text.

Target.Name: 7.RL.2
Target.Description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

Target.Name: 7.RL.3
Target.Description: Analyze how particular elements of a story or drama interact (e.g., how setting shapes the characters or plot).

Target.Name: 7.RL.6
Target.Description: Analyze how an author develops and contrasts the points of view of different characters or narrators in a text.

Target.Name: 8.RL.2
Target.Description: Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to supporting ideas; provide an objective summary of the text.

Target.Name: 8.RL.3
Target.Description: Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

Target.Name: 8.RL.6
Target.Description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author acknowledges and responds to conflicting evidence or viewpoints.

Target.Name: 9.RL.2
Target.Description: Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to supporting ideas; provide an objective summary of the text.

Target.Name: 9.RL.3
Target.Description: Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

Target.Name: 9.RL.6
Target.Description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author acknowledges and responds to conflicting evidence or viewpoints.

Target.Name: 11-12.RL.3
Target.Description: Analyze the impact of the author’s choices regarding how to develop and relate elements of a story or drama (e.g., where a story is set, how the action is ordered, how the characters are introduced and developed).

Target.Name: 11-12.RL.7
Target.Description: Analyze multiple interpretations of a story, drama, or poem (e.g., recorded or live production of a play or recorded novel or poetry), evaluating how each version interprets the source text. (Include at least one play by Shakespeare and one play by an American dramatist.)

Target.Name: 11-12.RL.9
Target.Description: Demonstrate knowledge of eighteenth-, nineteenth- and early-twentieth-century foundational works of American literature, including how two or more texts from the same period treat similar themes or topics.

Target.Name: 3.RL.9
Target.Description: Compare and contrast the themes, settings, and plots of stories written by the same author about the same or similar characters (e.g., in books from a series).

Target.Name: 4.RL.6
Target.Description: Compare and contrast the point of view from which different stories are narrated, including the difference between first- and third-person narrations.

Target.Name: 4.RL.7
Target.Description: Make connections between the text of a story or drama and a visual or oral presentation of the text, identifying where each version reflects specific descriptions and directions in the text.

Target.Name: 4.RL.9
Target.Description: Compare and contrast the treatment of similar themes and topics (e.g., opposition of good and evil) and patterns of events (e.g., the quest) in stories, myths, and traditional literature from different cultures.

Target.Name: 5.RL.6
Target.Description: Describe how a narrator’s or speaker’s point of view influences how events are described.

Target.Name: 5.RL.9
Target.Description: Compare and contrast stories in the same genre (e.g., mysteries and adventure stories) on their approaches to similar themes and topics.

Target.Name: 6.RL.3
Target.Description: Describe how a particular story’s or drama’s plot unfolds in a series of episodes as well as how the characters respond or change as the plot moves toward a resolution.

Target.Name: 6.RL.6
Target.Description: Explain how an author develops the point of view of the narrator or speaker in a text.

Target.Name: 6.RL.9
Target.Description: Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories) in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics.

Target.Name: 7.RL.6
Target.Description: Analyze how an author develops and contrasts the points of view of different characters or narrators in a text.

Target.Name: 7.RL.9
Target.Description: Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history.

Target.Name: 8.RL.3
Target.Description: Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

Target.Name: 8.RL.9
Target.Description: Analyze a case in which two or more texts provide conflicting information on the same topic and identify where the texts disagree on matters of fact or interpretation.

Target.Name: 9.RL.3
Target.Description: Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

Target.Name: 9.RL.9
Target.Description: Analyze a case in which two or more texts provide conflicting information on the same topic and identify where the texts disagree on matters of fact or interpretation.

Target.Name: 11-12.RL.5
Target.Description: Analyze how an author’s choices concerning how to structure specific parts of a text (e.g., the choice of where to begin or end a story, the choice to provide a comedic or tragic resolution) contribute to its overall structure and meaning as well as its aesthetic impact.

Target.Name: 11-12.RL.7
Target.Description: Analyze multiple interpretations of a story, drama, or poem (e.g., recorded or live production of a play or recorded novel or poetry), evaluating how each version interprets the source text. (Include at least one play by Shakespeare and one play by an American dramatist.)

Target.Name: 3.RL.5
Target.Description: Refer to parts of stories, dramas, and poems when writing or speaking about a text, using terms such as chapter, scene, and stanza; describe how each successive part builds on earlier sections.

Target.Name: 3.RL.7
Target.Description: Explain how specific aspects of a text’s illustrations contribute to what is conveyed by the words in a story (e.g., create mood, emphasize aspects of a character or setting).

Target.Name: 4.RL.5
Target.Description: Explain major differences between poems, drama, and prose, and refer to the structural elements of poems (e.g., verse, rhythm, meter) and drama (e.g., casts of characters, settings, descriptions, dialogue, stage directions) when writing or speaking about a text.

Target.Name: 5.RL.5
Target.Description: Explain how a series of chapters, scenes, or stanzas fits together to provide the overall structure of a particular story, drama, or poem.

Target.Name: 5.RL.7
Target.Description: Analyze how visual and multimedia elements contribute to the meaning, tone, or beauty of a text (e.g., graphic novel, multimedia presentation of fiction, folktale, myth, poem).

Target.Name: 6.RL.5
Target.Description: Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the theme, setting, or plot.

Target.Name: 6.RL.7
Target.Description: Compare and contrast the experience of reading a story, drama, or poem to listening to or viewing an audio, video, or live version of the text, including contrasting what they “see” and “hear” when reading the text to what they perceive when they listen or watch.

Target.Name: 7.RL.5
Target.Description: Analyze how a drama’s or poem’s form or structure (e.g., soliloquy, sonnet) contributes to its meaning.

Target.Name: 7.RL.7
Target.Description: Compare and contrast a written story, drama, or poem to its audio, filmed, staged, or multimedia version, analyzing the effects of techniques unique to each medium (e.g., lighting, sound, color, or camera focus and angles in a film).

Target.Name: 8.RL.5
Target.Description: Analyze in detail the structure of a specific paragraph in a text, including the role of particular sentences in developing and refining a key concept.

Target.Name: 8.RL.7
Target.Description: Analyze the extent to which a filmed or live production of a story or drama stays faithful to or departs from the text or script, evaluating the choices made by the director or actors.

Target.Name: 9.RL.5
Target.Description: Analyze in detail the structure of a specific paragraph in a text, including the role of particular sentences in developing and refining a key concept.

Target.Name: 9.RL.7
Target.Description: Analyze the extent to which a filmed or live production of a story or drama stays faithful to or departs from the text or script, evaluating the choices made by the director or actors.

Target.Name: 11-12.L.5a
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g., hyperbole, paradox) in context and analyze their role in the text.

Target.Name: 11-12.RL.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in the text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including words with multiple meanings or language that is particularly fresh, engaging, or beautiful. (Include Shakespeare as well as other authors.)

Target.Name: 9-10.L.5a
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g., euphemism, oxymoron) in context and analyze their role in the text.

Target.Name: 3.L.5a
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings. A) Distinguish the literal and nonliteral meanings of words and phrases in context (e.g., take steps).

Target.Name: 3.RL.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, distinguishing literal from nonliteral language.

Target.Name: 4.L.5a
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Explain the meaning of simple similes and metaphors (e.g., as pretty as a picture) in context.

Target.Name: 4.L.5b
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

Target.Name: 5.L.5a
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figurative language, including similes and metaphors, in context.

Target.Name: 5.L.5b
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. B) Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

Target.Name: 5.RL.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative language such as metaphors and similes.

Target.Name: 6.L.5a
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g., personification) in context.

Target.Name: 6.L.5c
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).

Target.Name: 6.RL.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

Target.Name: 7.L.5a
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g., literary, biblical, and mythological allusions) in context.

Target.Name: 7.L.5c
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. C) Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., refined, respectful, polite, diplomatic, condescending).

Target.Name: 7.RL.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of rhymes and other repetitions of sounds (e.g., alliteration) on a specific verse or stanza of a poem or section of a story or drama.

Target.Name: 8.L.5a
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g. verbal irony, puns) in context.

Target.Name: 8.RL.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

Target.Name: 9.L.5a
Target.Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings. A) Interpret figures of speech (e.g. verbal irony, puns) in context.

Target.Name: 9.RL.4
Target.Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

Target.Name: 11-12.W.6
Target.Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products in response to ongoing feedback, including new arguments or information.

Target.Name: 3.W.6
Target.Description: With guidance and support from adults, use technology to produce and publish writing (using keyboarding skills) as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

Target.Name: 4.W.6
Target.Description: With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of one page in a single sitting.

Target.Name: 5.W.6
Target.Description: With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of two pages in a single sitting.

Target.Name: 6.W.6
Target.Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of three pages in a single sitting.

Target.Name: 7.W.6
Target.Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and link to and cite sources as well as to interact and collaborate with others, including linking to and citing sources.

Target.Name: 8.W.6
Target.Description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and present the relationships between information and ideas efficiently as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

Target.Name: 11-12.W.3a
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences. A) Engage and orient the reader by setting out a problem, situation, or observation and its significance, establishing one or multiple point(s) of view, and introducing a narrator and/or characters; create a smooth progression of experiences or events.

Target.Name: 11-12.W.3b
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences. B) Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, reflection, and multiple plot lines, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

Target.Name: 11-12.W.3c
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences. C) Use a variety of techniques to sequence events so that they build on one another to create a coherent whole and build toward a particular tone and outcome (e.g., a sense of mystery, suspense, growth, or resolution).

Target.Name: 11-12.W.3d
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences. D) Use precise words and phrases, telling details, and sensory language to convey a vivid picture of the experiences, events, setting, and/or characters.

Target.Name: 11-12.W.3e
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences. E) Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on what is experienced, observed, or resolved over the course of the narrative.

Target.Name: 3.W.3a
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. A) Establish a situation and introduce a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

Target.Name: 3.W.3b
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. B) Use dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts, and feelings to develop experiences and events or show the response of characters to situations.

Target.Name: 3.W.3c
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. C) Use temporal words and phrases to signal event order.

Target.Name: 3.W.3d
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. D) Provide a sense of closure.

Target.Name: 4.W.3a
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. A) Orient the reader by establishing a situationand introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

Target.Name: 4.W.3b
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. B) Use dialogue and description to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to situations.

Target.Name: 4.W.3c
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. C) Use a variety of transitional words and phrases to manage the sequence of events.

Target.Name: 4.W.3d
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. D) Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.

Target.Name: 4.W.3e
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. E) Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

Target.Name: 5.W.3a
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. A) Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

Target.Name: 5.W.3b
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. B) Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, description, and pacing, to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to situations.

Target.Name: 5.W.3c
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. C) Use a variety of transitional words, phrases, and clauses to manage the sequence of events.

Target.Name: 5.W.3d
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. D) Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.

Target.Name: 5.W.3e
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. E) Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

Target.Name: 6.W.3a
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. A) Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

Target.Name: 6.W.3b
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. B) Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

Target.Name: 6.W.3c
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. C) Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.

Target.Name: 6.W.3d
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. D) Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to convey experiences and events.

Target.Name: 6.W.3e
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. E) Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

Target.Name: 7.W.3a
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. A) Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

Target.Name: 7.W.3b
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. B) Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

Target.Name: 7.W.3c
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. C) Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and lauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.

Target.Name: 7.W.3d
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. D) Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.

Target.Name: 7.W.3e
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. E) Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

Target.Name: 8.W.3a
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. A) Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

Target.Name: 8.W.3b
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. B) Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, and reflection, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

Target.Name: 8.W.3c
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. C) Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence, signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another, and show the relationships among experiences and events.

Target.Name: 8.W.3d
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. D) Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.

Target.Name: 8.W.3e
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. E) Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

A) Engage and orient the reader by setting out a problem, situation, or observation and its significance, establishing one or multiple point(s) of view, and introducing a narrator and/or characters; create a smooth progression of experiences or events.

Target.Name: 11-12.W.3b
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences. B) Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, reflection, and multiple plot lines, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

Target.Name: 11-12.W.3c
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences. C) Use a variety of techniques to sequence events so that they build on one another to create a coherent whole and build toward a particular tone and outcome (e.g., a sense of mystery, suspense, growth, or resolution).

D) Use precise words and phrases, telling details, and sensory language to convey a vivid picture of the experiences, events, setting, and/or characters.

Target.Name: 11-12.W.4
Target.Description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

Target.Name: 11-12.W.5
Target.Description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on addressing what is most significant for a specific purpose and audience. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 up to and including grades 11–12 on page 54.)

Target.Name: 11-12.W.9a
Target.Description: Draw evidence form literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. A) Apply grades 11–12 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Demonstrate knowledge of eighteenth-, nineteenth- and early-twentieth-century foundational works of American literature, including how two or more texts from the same period treat similar themes or topics”).

Target.Name: 11-12.W.9b
Target.Description: Draw evidence form literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. B) Apply grades 11–12 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Delineate and evaluate the reasoning in seminal U.S. texts, including the application of constitutional principles and use of legal reasoning [e.g., in U.S. Supreme Court Case majority opinions and dissents) and the premises, purposes, and arguments in works of public advocacy (e.g., The Federalist, presidential addresses]”).

Target.Name: 3.W.3a
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. A) Establish a situation and introduce a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

Target.Name: 3.W.3b
Target.Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences. B) Use dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts, and feelings to develop experiences and events or show the response of characters to situations.

Target.Name: 8.W.2a
Target.Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. Target.Name: 11-12.W.1a
Target.Description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence. A) Introduce precise, knowledgeable claim(s), establish the significance of the claim(s), distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and create an organization that logically sequences claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

Target.Name: 11-12.W.1b
Target.Description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence. B) Develop claim(s) and counterclaims fairly and thoroughly, supplying the most relevant evidence for each while pointing out the strengths and limitations of both in a manner that anticipates the audience’s knowledge level, concerns, values, and possible biases.

Target.Name: 11-12.W.1c
Target.Description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence. C) Use words, phrases, and clauses as well as varied syntax to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion, and clarify the relationships between claim(s) and reasons, between reasons and evidence, and between claim(s) and counterclaims.

Target.Name: 11-12.W.1d
Target.Description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence. D) Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone while attending to the norms and conventions of the discipline in which they are writing.

Target.Name: 11-12.W.1e
Target.Description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence. E) Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented.
